sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"绝望，沮丧"之意。
means: despair ： 普通用词，指因灾难等因素而丧失希望和信心，陷入沮丧，绝望的境地。
desperation ： 语气强烈，指因绝望而使人采取无所顾忌的疯狂行动。
depression ： 侧重指因遭受重大失利或挫折而产生的低落情绪。
disappointment ： 多指愿望或期望的落空。

sentence.Network_en: Don't let yourself despair; this will only make matters worse.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要想不开，这样只能使情况变得更糟。

sentence.Network_en: I would overcome any weakness, any despair, any fear.
sentence.Network_cn: 我要克服所有的软弱、绝望和恐惧。

sentence.Network_en: As his energy drained away, his despair and worry grew.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他的精力耗尽时，他的绝望和担心也增加了。

jx.jx_en_mean: be the cause of a feeling of hopelessness in (someone else)

lj.lj_ly: such students can be the despair of conscientious teachers.
lj.lj_ls: 这种学生让尽心尽责的老师们感到绝望。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: the noun via Anglo-Norman French from Old French desespeir; the verb from Old French desperer, from Latin desperare, from de- 'down from' + sperare 'to hope'

entry.def: Despair is the feeling that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve.

example.ex: I looked at my wife in despair...

entry.def: If you despair, you feel that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve.

example.ex: 'Oh, I despair sometimes,' he says in mock sorrow...
example.tran: “啊，我有时会感到绝望，”他假装悲伤地说。

example.ex: He does despair at much of the press criticism.
example.tran: 面对媒体的诸多批评他的确感到绝望。

entry.tran: 对…感到绝望;对…不抱希望
entry.def: If you despair of something, you feel that there is no hope that it will happen or improve. If you despair of someone, you feel that there is no hope that they will improve.

example.ex: He wished to earn a living through writing but despaired of doing so.
example.tran: 他想通过写作来谋生，不过他对此不抱希望。

example.ex: ...efforts to find homes for people despairing of ever having a roof over their heads...
example.tran: 为那些对有瓦遮头不再抱有任何希望的人们找到住处的努力

means.word_mean: 1. a state in which everything seems wrong and will turn out badly;

sentences.sentence: "they were rescued from despair at the last minute"

means.word_mean: 2. the feeling that everything is wrong and nothing will turn out well
1. abandon hope; give up hope; lose heart;

auth_sentence.content: Where there is despair, may we bring hope.
auth_sentence.res_content: Where there is despair, may we bring hope.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Where there is despair, may we bring hope.

auth_sentence.content: If the regimen sounds punishing, don't despair.
auth_sentence.res_content: If the regimen sounds punishing, don't despair.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: If the regimen sounds punishing, don't despair.

auth_sentence.content: Chanel is in a Pitt of despair Poor Chanel.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chanel is in a Pitt of despair Poor Chanel.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chanel is in a Pitt of despair Poor Chanel.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 绝望;失望;令人失望的人[事物]

sentences.en: Defeat after defeat filled us with despair.
sentences.cn: 一次又一次的失败使我们完全绝望了。

sentences.en: The boy is the despair of his teachers.
sentences.cn: 这男孩使老师们感到无可救药。

means.word_mean: 绝望,失去希望,丧失信心

sentences.en: Don't despair; things will get better soon.
sentences.cn: 不必绝望, 事情不久就会好起来。

jushi.english: The boy is the despair of his teachers.
jushi.chinese: 老师们认为这孩子已无可救药。

jushi.english: Defeat after defeat filled us with despair.
jushi.chinese: 一次又一次的失败使我们完全绝望了。

jushi.english: He was in despair of ever being able to pay off his debts.
jushi.chinese: 他对自己能够清偿债务已不抱任何希望。
